article: After a lift by my mother, I was in the barber's. Then a lady walked in, "Sorry I am late but there is a(n)36 _ down the street and we were trapped. "Being a(n)37 _ teenager, I decided to see what happened. I _ the scene and there were police cars everywhere. As I was about to leave, I noticed the broken car had an R. I. T (Rochester Institute of Technology) label on the back windshield , which I was familiar with. So I decided to get a _ look but was stopped by a policeman. Before he could finish what he was saying, I _ him. "Does that car have an R. I. T label on the back?"  "Yes, it does. Now move..."  Once again I interrupted him and burst into 41 _ . Did my mom die there? There was no answer so I _ she did.  At that very moment, a million thoughts _ to me: she was dead; I didn't get to say goodbye or I love her: The policemen asked me the 44 _ questions: where do you live; is anyone at home? etc. I could _ breathe, let alone talk, but I _ to say our phone number. They called my brother. After a while, he hurried up to the _ . My brother took care of the _ of the accident, calling everyone who needed to know. 49 _ , I lay on the ground soaking the carpet with my tears. I finally calmed down and just sat there, waiting for something from my dad or the hospital. Why did I ask her for a _ ? I could have walked. Finally, my dad told us the latest news: she was badly _ ; all in all, she was alive. Six years have gone by since that _ day, which will live in mind forever. What if she had died? I never would have been able to give her another hug, a thank-you. She would never know how much I _ everything she has done and how much I care. Every time I pass by the scene, I breathe a sigh of _ that she made it through. I will always treasure the days when I own mother's love.
